page.title: 15Tarset Castle
page.content: The site of the castle is a huge earth mound with steeply sloping sides. On the west and north it is bounded by the Tarset burn and a deep dry ditch has been dug around the eastern side. On top is a surprisingly large, level area with some grass-grown stone foundations. The old railway cuts through the southern side where the slope falls steeply to the valley floor. From the top we had mignificent views up the Tarset valley and both up and down the North Tyne valley. We could see the site, overlooking crossing places on both Tyne and Tarset, had been well chosen for defence. There are some unusual chiselled steps to the loft at Tarset hall. We think these may have come from the castle as we think the stone to build the house did also.
